intro: Sida anodifolia, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Sida anodifolia is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
